title: Typewriter-like font with huge round serifs
content:
Hi,

I would like to know a name for this font, I have no pictures of it though.

It is basically looking like American Typewriter, but has really big, round serifs (like serif "balls"). Overall, it's a very american, very 70s sort of font.

Any ideas?

Thanks in anticipation!!

Herb
author: huggyGiraffe

comments.content:
Hi,

no, it's not the good old Cooper. More [like Clarendon](http://web.archive.org/web/20100716203834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/clarendon/).

If you look at the Clarendon lowercase "y" that's the serif balls I am talking about, but they need to be A LOT bigger, like really exaggerated ly big.
Sounds like you need someone with a 70's Letraset catalog. Sounds like one of their display faces.

if that's what it sounds like i  
'm happy with that

Is this what you're looking for?

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/typewriter-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100716203834/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/typewriter-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/typewriter-mt/")

Hi Patty,

sorry, not at all...

Thanks for trying!
